intro: Soliva radiata, commonly known as silverleaf sida, is a flowering plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is native to the Americas and is characterized by its silver-gray foliage, which gives it its common name. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically green or yellowish in color. It thrives in dry, arid environments and is often found in disturbed soils. Soliva radiata is sometimes used in traditional medicine, though its botanical properties are not extensively studied.
